TITLE: Defining a Theme for Emotion in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: These examples show how to define a theme type for Emotion in TypeScript by extending the `@emotion/react` module. This setup allows using emotion with the automatic JSX transform and imports the `jsx` function from `@emotion/react`. The "emotion" plugin must be the first one in the plugins array. This is crucial for the plugin to function correctly. SOURCE: https://github.com/emotion-js/emotion/blob/main/docs/install.mdx#_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "plugins": ["@emotion"] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Styling HTML elements with Emotion styled DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to style a basic HTML element (button) using `@emotion/styled` with tagged template literals for CSS-like syntax. The styled component is then rendered within a React component.
